title: National guard shooting suspect to be charged with murder as Trump steps up immigration crackdown – US politics live
summary: The U.S. Attorney for Washington, D.C. has escalated charges to first-degree murder following the death of a National Guard member. Meanwhile, the U.S. President announced plans to "permanently pause" migration from countries designated as "third world." These developments highlight ongoing legal and immigration issues in the country.

title: UK at risk of ‘sudden confidence crisis’ if markets lose faith in budget – business live
summary: Economic and financial news continues to unfold, highlighting market fluctuations and trends. Key indicators such as inflation rates and employment figures are under scrutiny. Analysts provide ongoing commentary on potential impacts and future projections.

title: Putin praises Orbán’s ‘balanced’ position on Ukraine as leaders meet in Moscow – Europe live
summary: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orbán met with Russian President Vladimir Putin at the Kremlin, where they discussed various bilateral issues. A key focus of their meeting was on energy deliveries between Hungary and Russia. The discussions highlight ongoing cooperation despite geopolitical tensions.

title: Palmer fit to start against Arsenal; Iran to boycott World Cup draw – football live
summary: A rolling report has been launched to provide the latest updates and reactions in the world of football as the weekend approaches. Writers will share real-time news and insights. Stay tuned for continuous coverage and developments.

title: No 10 dismisses claim that OBR revelations show Reeves misled public about need for tax rises in budget – UK politics live
summary: Downing Street has denied allegations that the chancellor misled the public regarding the state of the country's finances prior to the upcoming budget. The claims suggest discrepancies in the government's financial messaging. Officials maintain that the chancellor has been transparent in his statements.
